results.title: The Pollution crisis
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Conserving Our Environment”.
As population increases, waste products are discarded in such increasing quantities that they cannot be absorbed by the environment, and pollution reaches crisis proportions. Shows some of the ways we are polluting our land, sea and air, and offers various solutions for protecting our environment.

results.title: The Politics of persuasion
results.creator_credit: Mark Zannis, ONF | NFB and Martin Defalco
results.brief_description: The story of how Torontonian John Bulloch turned a local tax protest movement into an efficient, media-wise, national lobbying organization that defends the interests of the small business community. Bulloch, the aggressive and articulate president and founder of the Canadian Federation of Independent Business (CFIB), understands the value of information and the techniques of power lobbying. This film shows how he and his 150-member CFIB staff acquired enough political savvy and clout to make legislators listen. The documentary also presents the views of those who are lobbied (with an explanation of power lobbying) and an analysis of the CFIB’s success.

results.title: The Politician's love story
results.creator_credit: American Mutoscope and Biograph Company and D.W. Griffith
results.brief_description: When a corrupt politician discovers that a satirical cartoon in the newspaper was created by a rather pretty young female cartoonist his anger soon turns into lust. Cast includes Mack Sennett, Kathlyn Williams, Marion Leonard, Florence Lawrence, D.W. Griffith. Silent film with no intertitles.

results.title: The Polish National Radio Orchestra. No. 2
results.brief_description: The Polish national Radio Orchestra conducted by Jerzy Katlewicz plays the Symphony No. 4 in B flat major, Opus 60 by Beethoven and the Symphonic Poem “Les Preludes” by Liszt, as originally presented at the Capitol Theatre, Perth during their tour of Australia.

results.title: The Pole vault
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Track and Field Instruction”.
Analyses the various skills required for pole vaulting; illustrates the forces involved in run up, hang, bar clearance, and throw away from the bar. Also shows how a beginner can organize training to achieve success.

results.title: The Point
results.creator_credit: Nilsson House Music, Murakami-Wolf Productions, Jerry Good, Larry Gordon, Harry Nilsson and Fred Wolf
results.brief_description: Based on a fable by Harry Nilsson, this delightful family film is set in the land of Point. In Point, every object, including people, is moulded into a point. Into this world little Oblio is born; the first and only roundheaded child in the town. Oblio and his dog, Arrow, are punished for having no point and are banished to the Pointless Forest. It is not as lonely as they imagined for in the forest they meet several other creatures who have also been exiled because they were different. Join Oblio and Arrow as they discover that you don’t have to have a point to be accepted. Narrated by Ringo Starr and animated by director Fred Wolf.

results.title: The Point
results.creator_credit: William Weintraub, ONF | NFB and Robert Duncan
results.brief_description: Point St. Charles is a notoriously bleak neighborhood in Montreal, considered to be one of the toughest in all of Canada. Many of the residents are English-speaking and of Irish origin living in a French speaking community; many of them are also on welfare. It is a district poor in terms of community facilities, high unemployment, lack of educational facilities and opportunities, and juvenile crime. Voice and narration by Budd Knapp.
